Column Comment.0: METRIC IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the metric that is being captured. In manycases, metrics are captured during a project, but some metrics may be operational oron-going in nature.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.3: END DATE: The date that metrics were last measured for this metric.
Column Comment.4: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.5: METRIC NAME: The full name usually given to the metric for identification purposes.
Column Comment.6: METRIC PROCEDURE: May store the procedure used to validate or calculate themetric, or a call to the procedure, or a text description of the procedure. If desired, alink to the RM location of the procedure may be stored in PPDM METRICCOMPONENT.
Column Comment.7: PPDM METRIC TYPE: the type of metric that is being measured, such the count ofwells that have been quality controlled, the number of SW licenses that are in use,the time taken to complete an activity etc.
Column Comment.8: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ORGANIZATION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for anorganization of a company or organization.
Column Comment.9: ORGANIZATION SEQUENCE NUMBER: a unique number added to alloworganizations to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.10: OWNER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the businessassociate who is the owner of this metric.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: PROCEDURE IDENTIFIER: Identifier for procedures used for a system or table. Maybe a stored procedure, called procedure, function etc. In this case, the procedureused to calculalte the metrics.
Column Comment.13: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.14: PROJECTED FINAL COUNT: Where a data load or quality control project is beingmonitored, the total expected or projected final count, such as the total number ofwells to be corrected, the number of seismic lines to be loaded etc.
Column Comment.15: PURPOSE DESCRIPTION: A narrative description that explains why this metric isbeing measured.
Column Comment.16: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: START DATE: The date that metrics were first measured.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
